ai-ud8.8:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ai-ud8.8:1.3_0: Now at that time the dear and beloved granddaughter of Visākhā Migāra’s Mother had just passed away.
ai-ud8.8:1.4_0: Then, in the middle of the day, Visākhā with wet clothes and hair went to the Buddha.
ai-ud8.8:2.1_0: “So, Visākhā, where are you coming from in the middle of the day with wet clothes and hair?”
ai-ud8.8:2.2_0: “Sir, my beloved granddaughter has just passed away.”
ai-ud8.8:2.3_0: That’s why I came here in the middle of the day with wet clothes and hair.”
ai-ud8.8:2.4_0: “Visākhā, would you like as many children and grandchildren as there are people in the whole of Sāvatthī?”
ai-ud8.8:3.1_0: “But how many people, Visākhā, die every day in Sāvatthī?”
ai-ud8.8:3.2_0: “Ten people, reverend Sir, die every day in Sāvatthī,
ai-ud8.8:3.10_0: two people, reverend Sir, die every day in Sāvatthī,
ai-ud8.8:3.11_0: or at least one person who passes away every day in Sāvatthī.
ai-ud8.8:3.12_0: Sāvatthī is never without someone passing away.”
ai-ud8.8:4.1_0: “What do you think, Visākhā? Would there ever be a time when your clothes and hair were not wet?”
ai-ud8.8:4.3_0: Enough, sir, with so many children and grandchildren.”
ai-ud8.8:5.1_0: “For those who have a hundred loves, Visākhā, they have a hundred sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.2_0: Those who have a ninety loved ones,
ai-ud8.8:5.3_0: for those who have eighty loves, they have eighty sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.4_0: for those who have seven loves, they have seven sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.5_0: for those who have sixty loves, they have sixty sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.6_0: for those who have fifty loves, they have fifty sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.9_0: for those who have nine loves, they have nine sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.10_0: for those who have eight loves, they have eight sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.11_0: for those who have seven loves, they have seven sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.12_0: for those who have six loves, they have six sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.13_0: for those who have five loves, they have five sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.14_0: for those who have four loves, they have four sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.15_0: for those who have three loves, they have three sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.16_0: for those who have two loves, they have two sufferings,
ai-ud8.8:5.17_0: or one loved one have one suffering.
ai-ud8.8:5.18_0: “Those who have no loved ones have no suffering. They are free of sorrow, stains, and anguish I say.”
ai-ud8.8:6.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud8.8:7.2_0: and the countless forms of suffering in the world
ai-ud8.8:7.3_0: occur because of those that we love;
ai-ud8.8:7.4_0: without loved ones they do not occur.
ai-ud8.8:8.1_0: That’s why those who have no loved ones at all in the world
ai-ud8.8:8.2_0: are happy and free of grief.
ai-ud8.8:8.3_0: So aspiring to the sorrowless and stainless,
ai-ud8.8:8.4_0: have no loved ones in the world at all.”
